snippet: President Nicolas Sarkozy of France and his Socialist challenger, François Hollande, clashed on Wednesday night in their only televised debate before Sunday’s election.
abstract: President Nicolas Sarkozy of France and his Socialist challenger, Francois Hollande, clash in their only televised debate before the May 6 election; candidates attack each other passionately as they try to make their case to the voters; Sarkozy, who is trailing in the polls, could not deliver the clear victory in debate that many analysts think he needed to win the election.
lead_paragraph: President Nicolas Sarkozy of France and his Socialist challenger, François Hollande, clashed on Wednesday night in their only televised debate before Sunday’s election.

headline.seo: France Approaches the End of a Presidential Campaign With a Bitter Debate
headline.main: France Approaches the End of a Presidential Campaign With a Bitter Debate
headline.print_headline: France Approaches the End of a Presidential Campaign With a Bitter Debate
